title: Expression Language editor
content: Service Management provides a context-assisted editor to help you build expressions using Expression Language. When you are entering an Expression Language phrase, start by pressing CTRL and the space bar to display a drop-down list. The list includes both objects and functions. When you hover over the functions, a tooltip displays the function syntax with its arguments. Select an item in the list and press Enter or double-click it to select it. If you select a function, the function appears in the text box. You must complete the expression manually, by adding parentheses and the function arguments. If you select an object, the object appears in the text box. Enter a period manually. A second drop-down list is displayed, including the available fields and relationships for the selected object. If you select a relationship and enter a period, another drop-down list is displayed with the available fields. For example, if you select entity as the object, typing a period displays a list of

title: Expression Language functions and syntax
content: The following reference lists all functions and operations available in the Expression Language, organized by category. For a comprehensive explanation of the Expression Language syntax with examples, refer to the Expression Language documentation. Functions are grouped by functionality—if you know the relevant category, you can navigate directly to that section. These functions do not apply to System User Accounts. You can also search the page by pressing Ctrl+F, and entering the first few letters of a function or a word that describes what you are looking for. Use the Next and Previous buttons to move from one occurrence to another. General functions Function Description case_when Takes the first argument as the initial value, and then goes through each even-number argument and returns the value of the first odd-numbered argument after the first matching argument (like an "if-then-else" statement). Stops reading and returns the result once an even-argument is matched with the first a

title: Expression Language examples by output type
content: The following examples demonstrate how to construct phrases in Expression Language for different purposes. Expressions that return a string value You can construct expressions that return a string value using text functions. For example, the expression ${concat('Error ','message')} returns Error message. You can construct expressions that return a string value using records and properties. For example, the expression ${entity.Type} returns the type of the current record and ${entity.PhaseId} returns the current phase of the current record. A property with a value of type Enum is a string value. For example, if the Urgency field is defined as an Enum type field, the expression ${entity.Urgency} returns the value of the Urgency field of the current record as a string. Note The DisplayLabel property of an Enum value type field returns the localized label based on the current user locale. For example, the expression ${entity.Urgency.DisplayLabel} returns the value of the Urgency field of t

Expressions that return a boolean value
Expressions that return a record value

title: Expression Language examples with record properties
content: When using the Expression Language to build phrases, you need to refer to the current record's properties, which are the fields of the record. It's recommended to open the Fields tab in a separate window while you are building an expression elsewhere in the system. Note When building an expression with record fields, make sure to use the field name rather than the field label. Recipient lists One common application of the Expression Language is building a list of recipients. The following are some examples of Expression Language phrases that return a recipient or a collection of recipients: ${first_non_empty_value(entity.AssignedPerson.Id, entity.AssignedGroup.Id, entity.OwnedByPerson.Id, entity.ServiceDeskGroup.Id)} This expression from Incident Management uses the first_non_empty_value function which selects the first value from the given arguments that's not empty. In this case, the arguments are: entity.AssignedPerson.Id. This expression returns the ID of the person related to the

title: Expression Language for notifications
content: Expression Language can also be used in notifications with a slightly different syntax. Expression Language syntax for notifications The notification expression template format is: ${paramName:defaultValue} where at least one of the values, paramName or defaultValue, must be entered (you can enter one or the other or both). paramName. A parameter of the current notification template. It returns the value stored in that parameter. defaultValue. A phrase using Expression Language functions. The notification includes whichever one of the above values is entered. If both values are entered, the paramName value is used if it exists for the current notification template. If it doesn't exist, the defaultValue value is used. In summary, the following options are available: paramName only. For example ${lastComment} means that the notification event contains the value in the parameter lastComment. (Note: no colon is required in this case.) If no such parameter exists for the notification templa

title: Fail to configure a load balancer (AKS)
content: When you run the patch command to patch a service from nodeport to loadbalaner type, the load balancer status is always Pending. You can use kubectl describe service XXX to check details. Then you will see the following error message: {"error":{"code":"AuthorizationFailed","message":"The client '3XXX-XXX-XXX-XXX-XXX1' with object id '3XXX-XXX-XXX-XXX-XXX1' does not have authorization to perform action 'Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/subnets/read' over scope '/subscriptions/6XXX-XXX-XXX-XXX-XXX9/resourceGroups/fredhtestgroup/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/fredTest-vnet/subnets/akssubnet' or the scope is invalid. If access was recently granted, please refresh your credentials."}} You will need the object id from the error message to resolve this issue. Cause The issue occurs because you don't have enough permission to update the Network Interface. You may need to assign the Network Contributor role to your servicePrincipal. title: Failed to launch controller with Init:Error for EKS upgrade
content: When you upgrade the suite on EKS, the upgrade fails because the controller pod is in Init:Error state. Additionally, if you check the logs of the pod,  you see "Permission denied" errors. Here are example steps to reproduce this issue. To check the logs of this pod, run the following command: kubectl logs -f -n <itsma_namespace> itom-bo-deploy-controller-pod -c itom-bo-deploy-controller-init-data The "Permission denied" errors you see resemble the following: rm: cannot remove '/pv/itsma/services/manifest.tmpl': Permission denied rm: cannot remove '/pv/itsma/services/manifest.yaml': Permission denied rm: cannot remove '/pv/itsma/services/service-property/new_install.tmpl': Permission denied If you further go to the EFS share folder /mnt/efs/var/vols/itom/itsma/global-volume and check the ownership of folder service-deploy-controller, you may receive a message that resembles the following: drwxr-xr-x. 4 root root 36 May 5 14:28 service-deploy-controller Cause This issue occurs because t

title: Failed to pull images during upgrade when McAfee on-access scan is enabled
content: When you try to upgrade OMT when McAfee on access scan is enabled, the upgrade process fails to pull images and the upgrade fails. If you check the pod log when this issue occurs, you see entries that resemble the following: failed to extract layer sha256:18c2069f7a9897b09047aa2ed5cae1ef0476729180af5053560a8d18e2b31dac: failed to unmount /opt/cdf/data/containerd/root/tmpmounts/containerd-mount4146036970: failed to unmount target /opt/cdf/data/containerd/root/tmpmounts/containerd-mount4146036970: device or resource busy: unknown. Note: You may experience issues such as memory leaks in OMT if you run a version of McAfee earlier than 10.7.  We strongly recommend that you run McAfee 10.7 or a later version. Cause This issue occurs because McAfee hasn't finished scanning when Containerd tries to load the image and then unmount the temporary directory. Solution You must exclude the following directories on the first control plane node from the on access scan during the upgrade. You can remov

title: Flannel pod doesn't start after you restart a node
content: When you restart a node, a Flannel pod doesn't restart. If you check the Flannel pod (kube-flannel-ds-amd64-xxxx) for errors, you find error messages that resemble the following: Warning FailedCreatePodSandBox 3m4s          kubelet      Failed to create pod sandbox: rpc error: code = Unknown desc = failed to set up sandbox container "6d5cc08c264973d09dc3da6529150921efa117a11de2b1b1757f8ed3fdefc989" network for pod "itom-prometheus-node-exporter-f5kwm": networkPlugin cni failed to set up pod "itom-prometheus-node-exporter-f5kwm_core" network: open /run/flannel/subnet.env: no such file or directory This issue occurs after you upgrade OMT. Cause This issue occurs because the kubectl command fails to patch the Flannel configuration during the upgrade, but later successfully upgrades Flannel. Although Flannel is successfully upgraded, it's missing some key configurations. Therefore, this issue occurs after you restart the node. Solution Run the following command to find which node the crash

title: Free disk space for control plane nodes and worker nodes
content: If you don't have enough disk space for the upgrade, perform the following steps to free up the disk space: Remove the offline download image directory if it exists. By default, the directory is /var/opt/cdf/offline. Remove the OMT build bundle file if it exists. The name of the bundle file resembles OMT_Embedded_K8s_<release number>.zip. Run the following commands to clean up unused images from the cache on the current node: for im in `ctr i ls | grep -- /pause: | awk '{print $1}'` do ctr i export bk-pause-`date +%s`.tar $im sleep 1 done crictl rmi -q ls bk-pause-*.tar | xargs -i sh -c "ctr i import {}; rm -f {}" If If you don't have enough disk space on the NFS server, you can also perform the following steps to free up the disk space: Locate the OMT log files folder on NFS server with the below command: kubectl get pv -o json|jq '.items[].spec | select(.claimRef.name=="itom-logging-vol")' |jq -r .nfs.path Go to the NFS server and remove the log files. Replace <nfs path> with the out

title: Failed to pull image because docker storage is full
content: You see a pod in image pull error state; when you run the kubectl describe pod [pod name]  -n [namespace] command, you receive an error that resembles the following: devmapper: Thin Pool has 157934 free data blocks which is less than minimum required 163840 free data blocks. Create more free space in thin pool or use dm.min_free_space option to change behavior. This issue normally happens during an upgrade when the suite system has experienced upgrades for multiple releases, causing the upgrade to fail. It may also happen during the normal operation of the system. Cause From releases to release, OMT pulls the images from the private registry (NFS) to the worker nodes and control plane nodes to start the containers; however, it doesn't remove unused images (for older releases). This may cause the docker storage to become full and hence an image pull error when the containers try to pull images to the worker nodes or control plane nodes. Solution Remove unused images by running the follo

title: Groovy script failure in OBM integration after upgrade to v25.4
content: After upgrading Operations Bridge Manager (OBM) to v25.4, the Run Test operation fails during the creation of an External Event Process request, with the following error: Ping failed due to the following error: Ping request to Connected Server 'OMi_Endpoint' on node '<OBM server host name>' failed with exception: org.springframework.remoting.RemoteAccessException: Could not access remote service [rmi://localhost:21303/ExternalProcessAccessService]; nested exception is java.rmi.UnmarshalException: Error unmarshaling return; nested exception is: java.io.WriteAbortedException: writing aborted; java.io.NotSerializableException: org.codehaus.groovy.control.CompilerConfiguration$1. Cause This issue occurs due to recent standardization updates to the Groovy script, which enforce stricter validation and security rules to ensure safer and more consistent execution. Solution To fix the issue, use the SMAGroovyAdapter script from the OMi Integration with Service Management Automation package v3.3

title: Failed to synchronize articles from SharePoint Online
content: After you set up an integration with SharePoint Online, the synchronization job in Service Management (Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints) fails and the following message is found in the <SharePoint Remote Connector>\logs\synchronize.log file: The sign-in name or password doesn't match one in the Microsoft account system. Cause This issue ocurrs not because you have configured an invalid SharePoint account. Instead, the failure reason is that access to your SharePoint Online site has been blocked due to conditional access policies. Solution Follow the Microsoft documentation to set the Access management for Azure resources option to No.

title: Failed to accept or reject Solution from email
content: When you enable email integration, if the Solution and the Completion Code are with valid values but the request isn't in the Validation phase, you will still receive an email with Accept and Reject options. In this case, after you accept or reject the solution from this email, you will receive an action failure email. Cause This issue is caused by the definition of request notification rules for sending solution and completion code with email integration. Solution From the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Studio > Fields. Select Request in the drop-down list at the top of the page. Click New field. Set the Name as "SendNotificaiton" and set the Logical type as "BOOLEAN", then save this field. Go to the Processes and Rules tab. Disable the following two rules: After change > the rule named "Notify requesters (Requested by person and Requested for person) that a solution was provided to the request. This notification does not contain email integration actions." After a

title: Failed to process email due to unauthorized email domain
content: The user receives the following email notification after sending an email: We could not process your email because the email address doesn't belong to an authorized email domain. To create, track, or update a request, log in to the Service Portal. Possible causes The user's email domain isn't defined as a permitted domain. Solution Make sure to define the user's email domain (for example, example.com) in the endpoint: From the main menu, select Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints > Configure > Advanced connection configuration > Authorized email domains. Enter the user's email domain and save the change. Restart the OPB service.

title: Email action fails because token has expired
content: The user receives the following email notification: We could not process this email because it has expired. To track or update the request, log in to the Service Portal. Cause Service Management failed to process an email action because the token contained in the email expired (too many days passed since the user received the email that contains the action link). Solution If permitted, extend the default token expiration time in the email endpoint configuration: From the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Service Portal Settings > Feature Settings. In the Specify email validity time frame field, select the desired time frame.
titleLower: email action fails because token has expired

title: Email action fails because token has already been used
content: The user receives the following email notification: We could not process the email because the action has already been performed. To track or update the request, log in to the Service Portal. Cause Service Management failed to process an email action because the token contained in the email was already used (the user already performed the action). Solution N/A.
titleLower: email action fails because token has already been used
contentLower: the user receives the following email notification: we could not process the email because the action has already been performed. to track or update the request, log in to the service portal. cause service management failed to process an email action because the token contained in the email was already used (the user already performed the action). solution n/a.

title: Email fails to be processed due to invalid security token
content: The user receives the following email notification: We could not process your email. The email's security token may have been altered. Try to send it again by clicking the same action link/button. To track or update the request, log in to the Service Portal. Cause Service Management failed to process an email action due to an invalid or altered token. Solution Make sure that the bottom part of the incoming email that contains the security token isn't changed. Contact Support if the problem persists for multiple users.

title: Email fails to be processed due to unknown user or address
content: The user receives the following email notification: We could not process your email. You may not be a registered Service Management Automation user. Contact your system administrator. To verify that you are a registered user, try to log in to the Service Portal. If you are a user, make sure to use the same email address that's listed for you in the system when you send emails. Note: To send this notification to users, the Enable error notifications to unknown senders option must not be turned off (default: ON) on the Administration > Configuration > Service Portal Settings > FEATURE SETTINGS page. Cause A user with the sender's email address was not found in Service Management. Solution Make sure the user's email address is correctly specified in the People module in Service Management (Administration > Master Data > People). Note: once an email address is identified as an unknown sender, the system will not process emails from this address until after 30 minutes. Contact Support if th

title: Email fails to be processed due to user mismatch
content: The user receives the following email notification: We could not process your email. The sender’s email address doesn't match the email address of the user who received the original email. Emails that were forwarded from other email addresses can't be processed. To create, track, or update a request, log in to the Service Portal. Cause The sender of the email and the user in the email's token don't match. This might occur if a user forwarded the email containing a token to someone else. Solution None. Contact Support if the problem persists for multiple users.

title: Email integration task doesn't start
content: The integration task doesn't start after configuring the endpoint. Cause Email integration tasks run every 30 minutes, so it may take up to 30 minutes for the mail polling task to start. Solution Wait up to 30 minutes. If the problem persists, manually restart RabbitMQ. For details, see RabbitMQ isn't ready.

title: Email integration tasks time out
content: Email tasks continued to fail with task timeout and the email was still in the inbox. As a result, no request was created from the inbound email. Cause The OPB agent needs a restart. Solution Restart the OPB agent manually. A request should be created from the inbound email.

title: Error on first synchronization from Service Management
content: On the first synchronization from Service Management to UCMDB, you may see an error message displayed similar to the following: Integration Point doesn't exist. No adapter for given target. Cause The cause for this issue is unknown. Solution To remedy this, do the following: Log in to the UCMDB instance. Go to Data Flow Management > Integration Studio. Right-click the integration point: <endpoint name>_<tenant id>, and click Edit. The Edit Integration Point dialog box appears. Deselect Is Integration Activated. Click OK. Select Is Integration Activated. Click OK. Go to the job in UCMDB and run a full synchronization.

title: Error when importing an image after upgrade
content: When a user tries to import an image using Image Aggregation after the suite upgrade, the following error message appears: Dependent <cloud_provider> capsule is missing. Download and install the same from ITOM Marketplace and try again. This issue can occur with any cloud provider such as AWS, Azure, GCP, or vCenter. Cause The dependent/required capsule isn't installed on the suite. Solution Download and install the latest capsule from ITOM Marketplace. Try to import the image again.

title: ESM API: Call to SMAX failed
content: Users see the following error with Status as 500 in the JSON response body when running the ESM APIs: "error": "Internal Server Error" In addition to this error, the itom-esm-api log file contains the following error: ERROR [System ] [https-jsse-nio-8080-exec-3] com.microfocus.esm.client.SmaxClient : Call to SMAX failedorg.springframework.web.client.HttpClientErrorException$Unauthorized: 401 : [no body] Cause This issue may occur because of an expired IDM authentication token. Solution Try the following solutions one after the other. Solution 1 Recreate the authentication token and retry the failed ESM API. If the issue persists, try Solution 2. Solution 2 Run the following commands on the control plane to restart the related pods: kubectl set env deployment/itom-esm-api SMAX_HOST_NAME=<HOST_FQDN> -n ${ITSMA_NAMESPACE} kubectl set env deployment/itom-esm-api SMAX_HOST_PORT=443 -n ${ITSMA_NAMESPACE} kubectl scale deployment itom-esm-api --replicas=0 -n ${ITSMA_NAMESPACE} kubectl scale d

title: External validation failed
content: When an LDAP user requests an offering, the External validation failed error occurs. The following error message is displayed: [WorkflowExecutionLogic.invokeValidationTemplate]: Failed to validate template [externalValidation] with parameters [{}]. Message is : External validation is failed. Cause This issue is caused due to the external validation timeout. The default external validation timeout interval is 10 seconds. Solution Follow these steps to enlarge the external validation timeout interval. The following example sets the interval to 20 seconds: In Postman, send a POST request with the following settings: URL: https://<host>:<port>/auth/authentication-endpoint/authenticate/token?TENANTID=<tenant-id> Select format as JSON and add the user name and password under the Body tab. Here is an example: {"login":"demoUser@example.com","password":"Password1"} Note: Be sure to use the user name of tenant admin in the Body. Click Send, you will find that your request now received the authe

title: External RAS network stack support
content: The external RAS installer supports both IPv4 and IPv6-based network addresses. When a URL specifies a fully qualified domain name as the hostname, the selection of the appropriate network stack is controlled by the Domain Name System (DNS). Connection testing might be slow or unreliable. Cause This occurs due to improper DNS resolution caused by bad DNS settings. Solution To restrict the network stack to a preferred type, perform the following steps: Unpack the RAS installer.Extract the setup.exe file.Edit the install.bat file and remove the -b %BUNDLE_LOCATION% %* and add before -cp one of the following properties: -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true (for IPv4) or -Djava.net.preferIPv6Stack=true (for IPv6).Save the file and run it from a command prompt.

title: Fail to connect to Smart Analytics
content: You encounter the error below and can't connect to Smart Analytics: Send request to pod <Name> timeout. Please run this script again. Exit. Cause This issue is caused by the abnormal status of Smart Analytics components. Solution Access https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>/bo/. Click CONFIGURATIONS > Smart Analytics > GO TO SMART ANALYTICS . Check the status of all components that are listed in the table and see if any component is in the Offline status. If there is any component in Offline status, log in to a control plane node of the suite and then run the kubectl get pods --all-namespaces | grep smartacommand to display a list. For example, NAMESPACE NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE itsma1 smarta-saw-con-0 1/1 Running 0 1d itsma1 smarta-saw-con-1 1/1 Running 0 1d itsma1 smarta-saw-dah-0 1/1 Running 0 1d itsma1 smarta-saw-dih-380843128-bc0c6 1/1 Running 0 1d itsma1 smarta-saw-proxy-3728899644-1vqz2 1/1 Running 0 1d itsma1 smarta-sawarc-con-0 1/1 Running 0 1d itsma1 smarta-sawarc-con-1 1/1 Ru

title: Fail to start the smarta-data-source and smarta-smart-ticket-task pods
content: The smarta-data-source and smarta-smart-ticket-task pods fail to start. The following error message appears in the pods' log files: Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: column "version_rank" doesn't exist Cause This issue is possibly caused by some exceptional database schema changes. Solution Log in to the Smart Analytics database with the owner permission or as a database manager and run the following command: ALTER TABLE schema_version ADD COLUMN version_rank integer;

title: Failed to trigger deployment of audit tenant error in Operation history
content: After deploying a tenant, you see the following message in the Operation history: Failed to trigger deployment of audit tenant Note If you see this message after deleting a tenant and then re-deploying it again, you can ignore the error. You don't need to perform these steps in this scenario. Cause The required secret either does not exist or contains invalid value. Solution Perform the following to determine the cause of the problem: Log in to a control plane node of the suite. Enter kubectl get pods -n itsma, and then press the Tab key. The terminal automatically completes the last parameter (namespace). Take note of the namespace (starts with itsma). You will use the namespace in the following commands. Run the following command: kubectl get secrets -n <namespace> Check whether audit-client-secret is in the returned list of secrets. If the secret is present, continue with the next step. Otherwise, regenerate vault secrets, and then reinstall the Audit service. See Install the Audit

title: Failed to import tenant because of mismatching crawling upgrade versions
content: When you export a source tenant and then import the data into a target tenant, the import fails with the following error: The data upgrade versions of the source and target tenants do not match [source tenant= ${tenantDataUpgradeVersion}, target tenant= ${targetTenantDataUpdateVersion}]. Where: ${tenantDataUpgradeVersion} and ${targetTenantDataUpdateVersion}] are the crawling upgrade versions of the source tenant and target tenant, respectively. Root cause The tenant export and import feature works only when the source and target tenants have the same version, including the same crawling upgrade version. If their crawling upgrade versions don't match, the tenant import fails. A typical scenario is that before having performed the required crawling upgrade for the source tenant, you export the source tenant and attempt to import the data to a new tenant. In this scenario, the target tenant has a newer crawling upgrade version than the source tenant and the tenant import therefore fails.

title: Global search results in Service Portal and Agent Interface differ
content: When using the same keyword for a global search in both the Service Portal and Agent Interface, the Service Portal is able to return results, but the Agent Interface sometimes fails to do so. Cause The Service Portal includes the parameter DetectLanguageType=true in the payload sent to IDOL, while the Agent Interface does not. Solution Add a tenant setting called ESS_BACKUP_FLAG4 to control whether the Agent Interface includes the DetectLanguageType=true parameter. By default, ESS_BACKUP_FLAG4 is false, indicating that the parameter is not included. To include it in the Agent Interface, set the value of ESS_BACKUP_FLAG4 to true as follows: Open a REST client such as Postman. Send the following Post request to get the SMAX token. URL (replace <hostname> and <tenantId> below with the real hostname and tenantID) https://<hostname>/auth/authentication-endpoint/authenticate/token?tenantId=<tenantId> Body (replace suite-admin with the tenant admin login name and replace password_for_admin wi

title: Fail to match intents if inputs are similar-looking characters in different languages
content: The smart virtual agent fails to match the intent if the characters in training sentences are similar-looking in different languages. Cause The NLU models are trained based on different languages. Therefore, for one intent, if user defines Japanese and Chinese as languages for training sentences, the virtual agent will have one model for Japanese and one for Chinese. When interacting with the virtual agent, it needs to identify the language of input, and then use the corresponding model to identify the intent. But the language detection function may not always be accurate, especially when dealing with similar-looking languages, such as Chinese and Japanese which have words in common. For example, the input "自宅住所" could be Chinese words or Japanese kanji. Perform the following steps to determine the issue: After the portal user sends the input, open the sanic_access.log file under nlu log folder (for example, /var/vols/itom/itsma/logging-volume/va/nlu/) Check if there is any log as "POS

title: Fail to log in to Service Portal with server error
content: When you attempt to log in to Service Portal, the following error occurs: Server Error. Please try to refresh, or come back in a few minutes. Cause This issues happens when the itom-xruntime-gateway service is restarted at the backend. When the service is recreated, it's assigned a new IP address by Kubernetes. However, Nginx in itom-xruntime-ui doesn't pick up the new IP address of itom-xruntime-gateway and still attempts to connect to the old IP address. Solution To work around this issue, restart the itom-xruntime-ui deployment/service.

title: Embedded JavaScript can't run in Service Portal
content: After you configured an embedded JavaScript to Service Portal, the JavaScript cannot run properly. The following error message is displayed: Failed to load external script! Possible causes Cause 1: Your browser blocks the website when the certificate installed cannot be verified by the browser. Cause 2: The embedded code cannot direct to the URL where the JavaScript is located. Cause 3: The JavaScript isn't loaded. Solution Make sure you have added the embedded JavaScript to Service Portal with URL included in the code. Access the JavaScript URL through your browser. If the Privacy error page is displayed, accept the certification as shown below. View page source through your browser. Verify the JavaScript is loaded under Head section.

title: Failed to load data error when My Group View is used
content: A ‘Failed to load data’ error occurs when using My Group View to display records assigned to the groups that the currently logged-in user belongs to. For example: My Group Inbox, My Group Tasks, and so on. Cause When a logged-in user is a member of numerous user groups, using My Group View can cause the Request URL length in the browser to exceed the maximum limit due to the application of filters on so many user groups. Solution Remove all the default filters and manually apply filters to the necessary groups. It is recommended that each user be a member of only a few hundred groups, ideally not exceeding 500, to ensure optimal performance during data retrieval when using the "My Group" view. This view allows users to see the records assigned to the groups of which they are currently a member.

title: Failed to load a user's dashboard page
content: When an agent user clicks My Dashboards > Dashboard, the following error message occurs: The system failed to load your dashboard page because of an error. Contact your administrator. Cause This error occurs because the user has no default dashboard explicitly defined in the Default dashboard field either in the user's Person record or in the user's profile, so the system should load the system default dashboard for the user; however, there's more than one system default dashboard found in the system, and hence the error occurs. Note It's impossible to set more than one system default dashboard by using the Set as system default button; however, it's possible to do this through a Mass Update or through a REST call. Solution The tenant admin must cancel unwanted system default dashboards, and make sure that the system has only one system default dashboard: Log in to the agent interface as the tenant admin. Navigate to Administration > Master Data > Deshboard Definitions. Add the System

title: Failed to load data when you select offerings
content: If you've created more than 2,000 service definitions and there's no offering defined under most of them, when you click the Offering button in the Request or Live Support page, the data load fails. Cause This error occurs because when there are too many service definitions with no associated offering, the system performance will be impacted. Solution To improve the system performance, you may exclude such service definitions from content filtering. For example, if there are many service definitions with the "Application" subtype, and there is no offering defined under them, you may follow below steps to exclude these service definitions from content filtering. In Postman, send a POST request with the following settings: URL: https://<host>:<port>/auth/authentication-endpoint/authenticate/token?TENANTID=<tenant-id> Select format as JSON and add the user name and password under the Body tab. Here is an example: {"login":"demoUser@dummy.com","password":"Password1"} Note: Be sure to use t
titleLower: failed to load data when you select offerings
contentLower: if you've created more than 2,000 service definitions and there's no offering defined under most of them, when you click the offering button in the request or live support page, the data load fails. cause this error occurs because when there are too many service definitions with no associated offering, the system performance will be impacted. solution to improve the system performance, you may exclude such service definitions from content filtering. for example, if there are many service definitions with the "application" subtype, and there is no offering defined under them, you may follow below steps to exclude these service definitions from content filtering. in postman, send a post request with the following settings: url: https://<host>:<port>/auth/authentication-endpoint/authenticate/token?tenantid=<tenant-id> select format as json and add the user name and password under the body tab. here is an example: {"login":"demouser@dummy.com","password":"password1"} note: be sure to use t

title: Expense lines aren't generated as expected
content: One-time expense line or recurring expense lines are not generated after the cost allocation rule is configured and triggered. Possible causes Cause 1: Allocate cost rule is disabled. In Service Management, from the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Studio. From the drop-down box at the top of the screen, select the record type on which you want to generate expense lines, and then select the Processes and Rules tab. Under the After Applying changes event, check if the Allocate cost rule is disabled. Cause 2: Allocate cost rule condition mismatched. In Service Management, from the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Studio. Select the record type on which you want to generate expense lines from the drop-down box at the top of the screen and select the Processes and Rules tab. Under the After Applying changes event, check the If condition of the Allocate cost rule. Cause 3: Cost allocation rule isn't active. In Service Management, from the main menu, selec

title: Error messages in carbon-footprint-deployment log
content: You may find some error messages in the carbon-footprint-deployment log. To check the carbon-footprint-deployment log, run the following command: kubectl logs --tail=20 deploy/itom-carbon-footprint-deployment -c itom-carbon-footprint-deployment -n <namespace> Possible causes Cause 1 The following error message indicates that the PostgreSQL server's pg_hba.conf file isn't properly defined with the database connection settings for the carbon database. Postgres DB Error! Failed to perform sql! CREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS carbon AUTHORIZATION maas_admin; no pg_hba.conf entry for host "xxx.x.x.x", user "maas_admin", database "carbon", no encryption error: no pg_hba.conf entry for host "xxx.x.x.x", user "maas_admin", database "carbon", no encryption Cause 2 The following error message indicates that the public key of PostgreSQL CA or server certificate is less than 2048-bit. Failed to perform sql! CREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS carbon AUTHORIZATION maas_admin; CA certificate key too weak Error:

title: Errors occur running ScalableImportTableSeparationUpdateCrawlingStep during upgrade
content: After you run the ScalableImportTableSeparationUpdateCrawlingStep crawling upgrade step, you find errors that resemble the following written to the maas_crawling_upgrade.log file: ScalableImportTableSeparationUpdateCrawlingStep failed to retrieve legacyJobIds from scalableImportState table... ScalableImportTableSeparationUpdateCrawlingStep failed to migrate data for JobId... Cause The cause of this issue is unknown. Solution Generate SQL scripts to migrate the results data from the scalableImportState tables to the scalableImportResult tables in the xservices_rms database. To do this, enter the xservices_mng database and run the following commands on the database client: \c xservices_mng; SET SEARCH_PATH=maas_admin,"$user", public; SELECT 'INSERT INTO "scalableImportResult_'||tenant_id||'" SELECT id, json_build_object( ''id'', state.id, ''jobId'', state.body::json->''jobId'', ''details'', state.body::json->''details'', ''sourceLayout'', state.body::json->''sourceLayout'' ) FROM "scalab

title: Error message "CMS connection: Invalid URL or port"
content: When configuring CMS Gateway in Suite Administration, the following error is shown. Cause The UCMDB Gateway URL or port is invalid. Solution Make sure the UCMDB Gateway connection parameters are valid and the Gateway service is running. In addition, UCMDB Gateway requires SSL/TLS, so make sure HTTPS is used rather than HTTP even if HTTP is enabled on the UCMDB side.

title: Federation between SMA OS type and UCMDB OsFamily
content: When Native SACM is enabled, the OS type field in SMA is federated with the OsFamily attribute in UCMDB. There are five preset OS values in either system, which are mapped according to the following table. SMA OS type UCMDB OsFamily Windows windows UNIX unix Virtual address extension (VAX) vax Mainframe mainframe Bare metal hypervisor baremetal_hypervisor Apart from these preset OS values, you can also have custom list values in both systems. If you have a custom OS type in SMA, you must manually create a corresponding OsFamily attribute in UCMDB. Make sure the suffix _c is not appended in UCMDB OsFamily value. In addition, these custom values are case-sensitive, we strongly recommend that you create precisely the same custom values in both systems. That is, to create a new OS type, make sure to use the same spelling and capitalization in both SMA and UCMDB. For example, you have a custom OS type value "Macintosh_c" in SMA, you must create an OsFamily value "Macintosh" in UCMDB. For mo

title: How to change log level
content: To change the log level on the UCMDB Gateway side, change the loglevel parameter in the UCMDB Gateway configuration.properties file. Log files of the UCMDB Gateway can be found in the logs folder in the installation directory. If you use Containerized UD/UCMDB Edit the values.yaml file used to install UD/UCMDB and add the cmsgateway.deployment.node.loglevel paramerer as below. On a control plane node, run the following command to apply the change to the UCMDB Gateway service. This will restart the UCMDB Gateway. helm upgrade <UD/UCMDB RELEASE NAME> <UD/UCMDB CHART FILE> --namespace <NAMESPACE> -f <VALUES YAML FILE> Where, <UD/UCMDB RELEASE NAME> is the release name of the UD/UCMDB deployment. <UD/UCMDB CHART FILE> is the tar file containing the UD/UCMDB installation charts. <NAMESPACE> is the namespace of the UD/UCMDB deployment. <VALUES YAML FILE> is your custom values.yaml file used to install UD/UCMDB. For example: helm upgrade ucmdb-prod ucmdb-helm-charts/charts/cms-2020.08.xxx.tgz
contentLower: to change the log level on the ucmdb gateway side, change the loglevel parameter in the ucmdb gateway configuration.properties file. log files of the ucmdb gateway can be found in the logs folder in the installation directory. if you use containerized ud/ucmdb edit the values.yaml file used to install ud/ucmdb and add the cmsgateway.deployment.node.loglevel paramerer as below. on a control plane node, run the following command to apply the change to the ucmdb gateway service. this will restart the ucmdb gateway. helm upgrade <ud/ucmdb release name> <ud/ucmdb chart file> --namespace <namespace> -f <values yaml file> where, <ud/ucmdb release name> is the release name of the ud/ucmdb deployment. <ud/ucmdb chart file> is the tar file containing the ud/ucmdb installation charts. <namespace> is the namespace of the ud/ucmdb deployment. <values yaml file> is your custom values.yaml file used to install ud/ucmdb. for example: helm upgrade ucmdb-prod ucmdb-helm-charts/charts/cms-2020.08.xxx.tgz

title: Having multiple offline pods results in duplicated CIs
content: If you have multiple offline pods and Native SACM enabled, duplicated CIs are synchronized from UCMDB to Service Management. Cause According to the Supportability table in Suite enterprise readiness, the itom-xruntime-platform-offline pod can't be scaled. That is, only one offline pod is supported. Solution Make sure there is only one offline pod.

title: How to prevent duplicate CIs from being created in Service Management
content: In UCMDB, each federated CI type (such as BusinessService, InfrastructureService, BusinessApplication, and Node) comes with default identification rules to prevent the duplication of key attributes (e.g., name) among different CIs. However, by default, Service Management doesn't have this restriction when creating new CIs, this may cause potential conflicts when data is synchronized with UCMDB through Native SACM. Although UCMDB eventually rejects such creations and flags errors for duplicated CIs, it's preferable to proactively validate and prevent such duplicates on the Service Management side. To achieve this, you can configure a validation business rule in Studio. For example, to ensure that no duplicated Actual Service with the same display label is created, you can add a validation rule within the "After Change" event, as shown below. If an attempt is made to create an Actual Service with a duplicated display label, the system will prompt an error window indicating the issue, as

title: Fail to design SAM reports from Service Management
content: The capability of designing SAM compliance reports from Service Management isn't available. Cause A possible cause for this issue is that you haven't configured the SAM required parameters when installing the classic or containerized UD/UCMDB. Solution If you're using a classic UD/UCMDB, set the following parameters in the config.properties file. See Install UCMDB Gateway on Windows or Install UCMDB Gateway on Linux. [sam] protocol=https host= port= If you're using a containerized UD/UCMDB, set the cmsgateway.deployment.sam.host parameter in your values.yaml file. See Service Management integration parameters.
titleLower: fail to design sam reports from service management

[sam] protocol=https host= port= if you're using a containerized ud/ucmdb, set the cmsgateway.deployment.sam.host parameter in your values.yaml file. see service management integration parameters.

title: Fail to calculate license consumption for Oracle DB
content: Attempts to calculate license consumption for Oracle DB fails. Cause SAM calculates Oracle DB license consumption according to the Oracle LMS document, which is Oracle-verified. A possible cause for the calculation failure is that information is missing from the Oracle LMS document. Solution To calculate license consumption for Oracle DB, use Universal Discovery jobs related to Oracle LMS, such as the Oracle Database Connection by SQL job and the Oracle LMS Data Collection by SQL job. For more information on how to collect Oracle LMS data, see Universal Discovery Content Pack documentation.

title: Get "Unknown" value for the publisher or the product version field
content: You might see the Unknown error in either of the following cases: On the Products page, the Publisher field of a product in the product list is <Unknown>. In the product version list on the General tab of a product, the specific version next to the product name appears as <Unknown>. Cause The discovered_vendor attribute of the installed software isn't discovered from UCMDB. The release attribute of the installed software isn't discovered from UCMDB. Solution Make sure the discovered_vendor attribute and the release attribute of the installed software have values in UCMDB. It's advisable that you use the Inventory Discovery by Scanner job to discover the installed software. In this way, the two attributes will be automatically populated with values for the installed software.

title: Failed to load SAM menus
content: When you access the SAM page, the system fails to load the menu items. Possible causes Cause 1: Some failed tenants are in the available tenant list for end users. That is, the tenant status is displayed as active, but actually the tenant is unavailable for access for reasons such as deployment failure or upgrade failure. Follow these steps to decide the cause: Go to the Network tab in Developer tools from your browser. Check if you can see the https://${samHost}/sam/smax/rest/${tenantId}/personalization/person/me/tenant API with an error response. Cause 2: The LWSSO cookie domain has been changed. However, the expired old domain token is still stored by the browser and sent to the back end of your system. Follow these steps to decide the cause: Go to the Network tab in Developer tools from your browser. Filter the requests by “/sam/smax” and see if all the response statuses are 401. In this case, other responses of SAM APIs should be fine. Solution Solution for cause 1 Check if there

title: Fatal error occurred
content: Capsule installation fails with a fatal error message that's displayed on the tile of the respective capsule in Content Store: Fatal error occurred Cause This issue occurs if the Content Store backend service restarts during capsule installation process. Restart may occur if the cluster isn't functioning properly or if the cluster has been restarted manually. Solution You will see this error when the backend service is restarting: Unable to load any available content(s) because Content Store service is temporarily unavailable. Once the service restarts, you will see this message: Fatal error occurred You can then reinstall the capsule.

title: Failed to import auxiliary file
content: Capsule installation may fail if any of the required auxiliary file import fails. You may come across the following error message: Failed to import auxiliary file '<File Name>' with status code: '<Version>'. Cause 1 This error occurs if there is a network issue. Solution Make sure your network connection is stable.

title: Failed to train the intents on a tenant with Aviator enabled
content: You failed to train the intents on a tenant with Aviator enabled. Additionally, the training of intents for virtual agents in classic mode failed across all tenants. Cause A network issue occurred or some database configurations have changed after you enabled the Aviator capability. Solution Restart the virtual-agent-admin-ui pod as the suite admin. For SaaS customers, contact the SaaS Operations team to do this for you.

title: EMS REST API
content: Introduction Service Management includes multiple REST APIs that may be used to execute a variety of commands. This document describes using the Postman client to access the EMS REST API. EMS stands for Entity Management System, and is used to access and modify information for most record types in SMA-X, such as incidents, requests, services, and configuration items. Before using the information in this section it will be necessary to review the information found in the ‘Configuring and Using the Postman REST Client’ section of this guide. This section explains how to install the Postman client as well as how to find the master node and tenant Id for a specific Service Management instance. This chapter will cover: Understanding the data structure of the API Determining the entity type and field names Handling specific field types Special considerations of the EMS API Locking system -- service behavior Retrieving information from Service Management Posting information to Service Managem

Determining the entity type and field names

title: Encryption domain API
content: The following APIs are available for use in connection with encryption domains: Revoke user from all encryption domains Enter the following DELETE request URI: https://<serverAddress>/rest/<tenant-id>/encryption/key_chain/<user-id> There are no parameters for this URI. The user's credentials are revoked for all encryption domains. Revoke user from a specific encryption domain Enter the following DELETE request URI: https://<serverAddress>/rest/<tenant-id>/encryption/key_chain/<user-id>/domains/<domain-id> where the domain-id is the ID of the required encryption domain. You can get the domain ID using the List encryption domains API. There are no parameters for this URI. The user's credentials are revoked for the specified encryption domain. List encryption domains Enter the following GET request URI: https://<serverAddress>/rest/<tenant-id>/encryption/domains There are no parameters for this URI. The API returns all the encryption domains defined on the tenant. The following is an exam

title: Flow authoring
content: Flow design Reusing existing content Because there are many flows and operations already created, check first if a flow or operation already exists using OO Studio ITOM Marketplace search capability and product documentation. Note The following pictures show how to use OO Studio ITOM Marketplace Search: Go to Configuration > Options > ITOM Marketplace to set the ITOM Marketplace credentials: The ITOM Marketplace Search pane is located at the bottom of the Studio Workspace. Right-click on a row to view the full description of the search results, or, to connect directly to the location of the content in ITOM Marketplace. Create modular flows It is a best practice to design modular flows rather than a single flow that performs all tasks, and it would be even better to have many subflows with very specific roles. title: Flow Authoring
content: Flow design Reusing existing content Because there are many flows and operations already created, check first if a flow or operation already exists on the ITOM Marketplace. Create modular flows It is good practice to design modular flows rather than a single flow that performs all tasks, and it would be even better to have many subflows with very specific roles. Each flow should have a single, well-focused purpose, executing one single aspect of the desired functionality. Also, the name of flow must be self-explanatory. Modular flows are: Easier to create. Separate more responsibilities into separate flows? Because each responsibility is an axis to change. When the requirements change, that change alters the responsibility of the flows. If a flow has more than one responsibility, then the responsibilities become coupled. This kind of coupling leads to fragile designs that break in unexpected ways when changed. Easier to test.
